Diagnosis
	1. Desmoplastic mesothelioma of right pleura
	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates
	None - new diagnosis

	Current disease status
	Extensive right pleural disease with chest wall invasion

	Current issues
	Progressive breathlessness
Right-sided chest pain
Weight loss of 6kg in 3 months

	Summary of consultation
	[redacted name] is a 72-year-old retired plumber with significant asbestos exposure who presents with a 4-month history of progressive breathlessness and right-sided chest pain. CT thorax performed on 15/3/24 showed extensive right pleural thickening with chest wall invasion. CT-guided biopsy on 20/3/24 confirmed desmoplastic mesothelioma, with immunohistochemistry positive for CD31 and Calretinin.

On examination today, performance status is 2. There is significantly reduced air entry on the right side with dull percussion note. Oxygen saturations 92% on room air. Weight 68kg (down from 74kg in December 2023).

Given the extent of disease and performance status, we have discussed treatment options focusing on symptom control and palliative chemotherapy with Pemetrexed/Cisplatin. Patient wishes to consider this and will return next week for final decision.

	Further investigations
	Baseline cardiac echo
Renal function and EDTA clearance
PET-CT for disease extent

	Medication prescribed
	MST 10mg BD
Oxycodone 5mg PRN
Pregabalin 75mg BD

	Follow up
	Review in one week with investigation results to confirm treatment plan

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function
Consider referral to community palliative care team
